Package main.core.elevatorsubsystem

Class ElevatorSubsystem

java.lang.Object
main.core.elevatorsubsystem.ElevatorSubsystem
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class ElevatorSubsystem
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
This class proivdes an implementation for the Elevator subsystem. The Elevator subsystem reads events from the Scheduler and handles them accordingly. TODO: there is a bug with the destinations queue not having the required information for the elevator (LOADING state).
Author:
Tony Zeidan, Evan Lloyd, Shaopeng Liu, Leenesh Kumar, YouHeng Zhou, Dominic Motora

      public ElevatorSubsystem​(int elevatorID, int port, ElevatorStatusObjController controller)

      elevatorID - The ID of this elevator (unique)
      port - The port that this elevator will send/receive messages from
      controller - The controller to be linked (if any, may be null)

    • sendReceive

      private ElevatorStatusObj sendReceive()
      Sends the elevator's data to the scheduler and retrieves a message from the scheduler.
      Returns:
      The information retrieved from the scheduler

    • updateAfterSendReceive

      public ElevatorStatusObj updateAfterSendReceive()
      Updates the elevator's fields after receiving a message from the Scheduler.
      Returns:
      The message received from the elevator

    • handleDoorsClosing

      private void handleDoorsClosing()
      Handles the doors closing. Used in transition to the door closing state.

    • handleCurrentState

      public void handleCurrentState()
      Provides the functionality for the handling of the current state, and switching to the next appropriate state.

    • run

      public void run()
      Executable for ElevatorSubystem threads. Progresses through the State Diagram by talking to the Scheduler. The Scheduler considers the present location and state of the Elevator and tells it what the next state should be. The Elevator considers its present state and the future state that was given to it by the Scheduler. Based on these inputs the Elevator performs the actions to handle the state transition.
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable

    • getStatusObj

      public ElevatorStatusObj getStatusObj()
      Retrieves the status object of this elevator subsystem.
      Returns:
      The elevator status object

    • moveElevator

      private void moveElevator​(boolean stopping, boolean up)
      Moves the elevator one floor up or down according to its current speed and whether or not it is coming to a stop.
      Parameters:
      stopping - Whether the car is stopping or not
      up - Whether the car is going up or down

    • checkMotorError

      private void checkMotorError()
      Check whether there is a motor error
